result.execSummary:
The defendant Deartay D. Watson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Deartay D. Watson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Deartay D. Watson was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Review hrg on 7/15/16 @ 10am.  P&P to provide written report by 7/12/16.  DOC may not reststrict the deft's residence or employment w/o court permission.  DOC shall promptly notify the court , in writing, of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

records.addlTxt: Revoked-Sentenced to County Jail/HOC on 12-1-16
Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Hans Koesser.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft sentenced to 60 days KCJ.  Credit for 50 days.
Atty Hans Koesser

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person pro se.  Report has been received from DOC.  Discussion ensues.  Deft's court costs were taken out of bond.  No further court taken at this time.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Catherine Lambrechts.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  Ct 2 - weapon enhancer dismissed on State's motion.  Deft pleads no contest to the amended charge; found guilty by the Court.  Count 1 is dismissed on State's motion.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for one year.  See conditions.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Catherine Lambrechts.  Defense counsel requests a short adjournment; deft missed his appt w/her.  Deft admonished about missing his appts with his attorney.  Plea/sentencing set for 5/9/16 @ 11am.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Catherine Lambrechts.  Defense counsel just appointed on 3/15/16 and requests dates for FPT/JS.  Offer was relayed a week ago; defense counsel requests time to conduct discovery.  FPT 4/21/16 @ 9:45am, JS 5/9/16 @ 9am.
Atty  C Lambrechts.

120 P.M.  Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.   Defendant appeared in court in person. Clk  Janell Thwing.    Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.   Warrant vacated.  Not Guilty plea entered by court. Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 01:15 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 09:20 am.  Jury selection scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 09:00 am.   $500 Continued posted Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  Remanded to custody.
DE posted $500 bond and was given a mandatory court date of 01-07-16 at 1pm Intake.
